Create a control list for files

Source: R/paths.R
files_control.Rd

Most users will not want or need to change data file and folder names or saving conditions, but it is helpful to have them be flexible for certain circumstances, and this function gathers them into a list for higher-in-the-pipeline functions.

files_control(
  directory = "portalPredictions",
  raw_data = "PortalData",
  filename_moons = "moon_dates.csv",
  filename_config = "dir_config.yaml",
  filename_cov = "covariates.csv",
  filename_cov_casts = "covariate_casts.csv",
  filename_meta = "metadata.yaml",
  save = TRUE,
  overwrite = TRUE,
  cleanup = TRUE,
  source_name = "current_archive",
  append_cast_csv = TRUE,
  arg_checks = TRUE
)

Arguments

directory

character value of the directory name.
raw_data

character value indicating the name of the raw data directory. A standard portalcasting directory downloads the raw data files into from the PortalData repository, so raw_data = "PortalData".
filename_moons

character name of the file for saving the moons data.
filename_config

character filename of the directory configuration YAML.
filename_cov

character filename for saving the output.
filename_cov_casts

character filename for saving the covariate casts output.
filename_meta

character filename for saving the metadata.
save

logical indicator controlling if the output should be saved out.
overwrite

logical indicator of whether or not the existing files should be updated (most users should leave as TRUE).
cleanup

logical indicator of whether or not the tmp files should be cleaned up.
source_name

character value for the name to give the covariate forecast. Currently is "current_archive". Previous to "current_archive", the data were retroactively filled in and are given the source name "retroactive".
append_cast_csv

logical indicator controlling if the new cast covariates should be appended to the historical casts later use.
arg_checks

logical value of if the arguments should be checked using standard protocols via check_args. The default (arg_checks = TRUE) ensures that all inputs are formatted correctly and provides directed error messages if not.

Value

Named list of names of the folders and files within the directory structure as well as saving strategies (directly as input).

Contents
